category_types.description: Items are types of X, parts of Y, or members/components of a conventional category (hyponyms/meronyms, functions/uses). Includes members of culturally fixed sets.
examples: SEEN AT AN ICE CREAM SHOP (CONE, CUP, LITTLE SPOON, SCOOP)
ELEMENTS OF A CLASSIC “MOM” TATTOO (ARROW, HEART, MOM, RIBBON)
ITEMS IN A LINEN CLOSET (PILLOWCASE, SHEET, TOWEL, WASHCLOTH)
LINGERIE (GARTER, HOSE, SLIP, TEDDY)
AIRPORT FEATURES (CAROUSEL, FOOD COURT, GATE, LOUNGE)
GUITAR PLAYING TECHNIQUES (BEND, PICK, SLIDE, STRUM)
PARTS OF A BIKE (CHAIN, PEDAL, SADDLE, WHEEL)
TV DISPLAY SETTINGS (BRIGHTNESS, COLOR, CONTRAST, TINT)
RESULTS OF SOME ARITHMETIC (DIFFERENCE, PRODUCT, QUOTIENT, SUM)
VALLEY (DALE, DELL, GLEN, HOLLOW)
BODIES OF WATER (BAY, CHANNEL, SOUND, STRAIT)
PARTS OF A SHOE (HEEL, SOLE, TONGUE, UPPER)
PLACES TO SHOP (BAZAAR, FAIR, MARKET, OUTLET)
KINDS OF PENGUINS (CHINSTRAP, EMPEROR, KING, MACARONI)
MEDICINE FORMATS (CREAM, PATCH, SPRAY, TABLET)
DRAPERY HANGING ITEMS (BRACKET, CURTAIN, HOOK, ROD)
COMPONENTS OF ONE’S GRADE (ATTENDANCE, FINAL, HOMEWORK, PAPERS)
MAP APP OPTIONS (DESTINATION, ROUTE, STARTING POINT, STOPS)
CLASSIC TOYS (BALL, BLOCKS, JACKS, TRAIN)
FENCING GEAR (FOILS, GLOVES, JACKETS, MASKS)
ITEMS IN A SEWING KIT (BUTTON, NEEDLE, SCISSORS, THREAD)
APPLE PRODUCTS (BRANDY, BUTTER, CIDER, SAUCE)
KINDS OF JEANS (BOYFRIEND, FLARE, MOM, SKINNY)
FICTION CATEGORIES (HISTORICAL, LITERARY, SPECULATIVE, YOUNG ADULT)
BOTANICAL COVERINGS (HULL, HUSK, POD, SHELL)
OBJECTS IN 0-, 1-, 2- AND 3-DIMENSIONAL SPACE (LINE, PLANE, POINT, SOLID)
NEWS ANNOUNCEMENT (BULLETIN, FLASH, REPORT, WIRE)
KINDS OF CHEESES (BLUE, GOAT, JACK, SWISS)
WOODWORKING HAND TOOLS (CHISEL, PLANE, RASP, SAW)
COMPONENTS OF A SALAD (CHEESE, DRESSING, LETTUCE, PROTEIN)
KINDS OF MACHINES (ENIGMA, PINBALL, SEWING, VENDING)
PARTS OF AN ANGEL COSTUME (HALO, HARP, ROBE, WINGS)
THINGS A DOG CAN FETCH (BALL, BONE, FRISBEE, STICK)
ICE CREAM TREATS (FLOAT, SHAKE, SPLIT, SUNDAE)
DANCE MOVES (CABBAGE PATCH, FLOSS, MOONWALK, ROBOT)
DENTAL ADDITIONS (BRIDGE, CROWN, FILLING, VENEER)
DO SOME GROOMING (BRUSH, DRESS, SHAVE, SHOWER)
AIRPORT BOARD INFO (ARRIVAL, DESTINATION, FLIGHT, GATE)
PRO ATHLETE DATA (COLLEGE, NUMBER, POSITION, TEAM)
KINDS OF LISTS (BUCKET, LAUNDRY, SHORT, TO-DO)
FIRED OBJECTS (CERAMICS, CHINA, POTTERY, WARE)

category_types.description: Groups of words/phrases with closely related meanings, including idiomatic paraphrases sharing a sense.
examples: PERSPECTIVE (ANGLE, BENT, LENS, POINT OF VIEW)
GODDESS (DIVA, ICON, LEGEND, QUEEN)
DIAMETRIC (COUNTER, OPPOSITE, POLAR, REVERSE)
CONNECT (BRIDGE, JOIN, LINK, UNITE)
COMMIT TO PAPER (AUTHOR, COMPOSE, PEN, WRITE)
FUZZY, AS A MEMORY (DIM, FAINT, REMOTE, VAGUE)
WITHOUT (ABSENT, MINUS, SANS, WANTING)
AUSTERE (BARE, PLAIN, SIMPLE, SPARE)
CRITICIZE (BASH, BLAST, PAN, SLAM)
MAKE HAPPY (DELIGHT, PLEASE, SUIT, TICKLE)
EXPRESSIONLESS (BLANK, FLAT, INANIMATE, WOODEN)
METTLE (FIGHT, GRIT, RESOLVE, SPIRIT)
SQUARELY (DEAD, EXACTLY, RIGHT, SMACK)
CAPTURE ON VIDEO (FILM, RECORD, SHOOT, TAPE)
STOCKY (SOLID, SQUAT, STOUT, THICK)
COMPANY (CONCERN, FIRM, HOUSE, OUTFIT)
STRICT (FIRM, RIGID, STERN, TOUGH)
IN FASHION (CHIC, CURRENT, FRESH, HAPPENING)
GREAT MANY (DROVE, HOST, LOAD, SCORE)
FLINCH (BOLT, JERK, JUMP, STARTLE)
STEAL (NICK, PALM, PINCH, POCKET)
DAPPER (NEAT, SHARP, SMART, TIDY)
KNOCKOFF (BOOTLEG, COPY, FAKE, REPLICA)
CORRESPONDENCE (CONTACT, DEALINGS, EXCHANGE, INTERACTION)
CON GAME (HUSTLE, RACKET, SCHEME, STING)
COMBINE, AS BAKING INGREDIENTS (BEAT, BLEND, FOLD, STIR)
YEARN (BURN, ITCH, LONG, PINE)
PARTICLE (CRUMB, GRAIN, MORSEL, SHRED)

category_types.description: Items linked by a shared attribute, function, scenario, or affordance without being strict synonyms or taxonomy members.
examples: CONSIDERATIONS FOR MOVIE RATINGS (ACTION, LANGUAGE, NUDITY, SMOKING)
ROUND FLAT THINGS (COASTER, FRISBEE, PANCAKE, RECORD)
NEEDS FOR PLAYING YAHTZEE (CUP, DICE, PENCIL, SCORECARD)
OBJECTS WITH TEETH (COMB, GEAR, SAW, ZIPPER)
THINGS THAT RING (ALARM, BELL, INTERCOM, PHONE)
THINGS TO CLIMB (LADDER, MOUNTAIN, ROPE, TREE)
ACTIONS WITH LIPS (CURL, PUCKER, PURSE, SMACK)
GRADUATED INSTRUMENTS (BEAKER, PROTRACTOR, RULER, SYRINGE)
THEY'RE ON A ROLL! (FOIL, TAPE, RIBBON, TOILET PAPER)
WHAT A DRINK IS SERVED WITH (COASTER, GARNISH, GLASS, STRAW)
THINGS TO BOOK FOR A VACATION (CAR, FLIGHT, HOTEL, TOUR)
BAD THINGS FOR A WEBSITE TO DO (FREEZE, GLITCH, TIMEOUT, QUIT)
QUALITIES OF A RAINY DAY (COLD, GRAY, WET, WINDY)
SEEN IN OPENING CREDITS (CAST, DIRECTOR, STUDIO, TITLE)
BEVERAGE SELF-SERVICE ITEMS (CUP, LID, NAPKIN, STRAW)
POSSIBLE RESULTS OF A TRAFFIC VIOLATION (BOOT, POINTS, TICKET, TOW)
SEEN IN THE AFTERMATH OF A RAINSTORM (EARTHWORM, MUD, MUSHROOM, PUDDLE)
METAPHORS FOR A DRAMATIC AND CHAOTIC EVENT (CIRCUS, ROLLER COASTER, SOAP OPERA, WHIRLWIND)
ASSOCIATED WITH FREUD (DREAMS, ID, OEDIPUS, SLIP)
FARMERS’ THINGS (ALMANAC, INSURANCE, MARKET, TAN)

category_types.description: Sets anchored by proper names: people, characters, places, brands, titled works, teams, awards, or specific named artifacts.
examples: HIT SONGS OF 1998 (CLOSING TIME, IRIS, ONE WEEK, TOO CLOSE)
DOGS OF THE SCREEN (ASTRO, BLUE, HOOCH, TOTO)
WHAT CHARACTERS WERE TRANSFORMED INTO IN "BEAUTY AND THE BEAST" (BEAST, CANDELABRA, CLOCK, TEACUP)
BEST PICTURE WINNERS SINCE 2000 (CHICAGO, CRASH, GLADIATOR, MOONLIGHT)
HEROES OF ACTION MOVIE FRANCHISES (BOND, JONES, OCEAN, WICK)
U.S.-BASED AIRLINES (AMERICAN, FRONTIER, SPIRIT, UNITED)
MAGAZINES (BILLBOARD, PEOPLE, STAR, TIME)
CHARACTERS WITH GREEN SKIN (ELPHABA, GRINCH, HULK, SHREK)
FIGURES IN CLASSIC DISNEY ANIMATED FILMS (ELEPHANT, FAWN, MARIONETTE, MOUSE)
PRO WRESTLING ICONS, WITH “THE” (HITMAN, ROCK, SNAKE, UNDERTAKER)
HBO SHOWS (ENTOURAGE, EUPHORIA, INSECURE, SUCCESSION)
LEGAL DRAMAS (DAMAGES, GOLIATH, MATLOCK, SUITS)
“SESAME STREET” FIGURES (BIRD, COUNT, GROUCH, MONSTER)
INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION INVENTORS (BELL, DIESEL, SINGER, WATT)
DRS (DRE, EVIL, PEPPER, SEUSS)

category_types.description: Items fill a common slot in fixed phrases, compounds, or idioms; or are parts of set expressions/titles/quotations.
examples: HOT ___ (DOG, POTATO, ROD, WATER BOTTLE)
___ TERRIER (BORDER, BOSTON, BULL, RAT)
___ STICK (CANDLE, CHOP, JOY, YARD)
___ STRIP (BACON, COMIC, LANDING, SUNSET)
MOTHER ___ (EARTH, GOOSE, MAY I, SUPERIOR)
___ CLEANER (BATHROOM, DRY, PIPE, VACUUM)
WORDS BEFORE "BED" (CANOPY, DAY, MURPHY, WATER)
___ MAIL (CHAIN, ELECTRONIC, JUNK, SNAIL)
SPRING ___ (CHICKEN, EQUINOX, FLING, ONION)
___ DUTY (CIVIC, CUSTOMS, HEAVY, JURY)
WAX ___ (MUSEUM, PAPER, POETIC, SEAL)
___ GLASS GLASSWARE (COCKTAIL, COLLINS, OLD FASHIONED, SHOT)
WORDS IN HEMINGWAY TITLES (BELL, FAREWELL, OLD MAN, SUN)
NOUNS FROM A DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE LINE (HAPPINESS, LIBERTY, LIFE, PURSUIT)
___ BROTHERS (BLOOD, BLUES, CHEMICAL, MARX)
SECOND WORDS IN DAVID LYNCH TITLES (DRIVE, HIGHWAY, PEAKS, VELVET)
___STONE (BIRTH, KEY, MILE, TOUCH)
WORDS AFTER “T-” (MOBILE, PAIN, REX, SHIRT)

category_types.description: Shared word-formation patterns: affixation, compounding, clippings, blends, reduplication, acronyms/initialisms; or systematic addition/removal of an affix.
examples: COMPOUNDS WITH -PROOF (BULLETPROOF, FIREPROOF, WATERPROOF, CHILDPROOF)
ACRONYMS/INITIALISMS (MIA, OMG, PIN, RAM)
MICRO- COMPOUNDS (CHIP, PHONE, SCOPE, WAVE -> MICROCHIP, MICROPHONE, MICROSCOPE, MICROWAVE)
COMPOUNDS IN ___MAN (BOGEYMAN, CRAFTSMAN, GENTLEMAN, SPOKESMAN)
E- THINGS (COMMERCE, MAIL, SCOOTER, SIGNATURE -> E-COMMERCE, E-MAIL, E-SCOOTER, E-SIGNATURE)
KINDS OF PANTS MINUS 'S' (CAPRI, JEAN, JOGGER, SLACK)

category_types.description: Visible letter/character patterns or transformations in written forms: palindromes, anagrams, substrings/prefixes/suffixes, repeated letters, typographic shape categories, or systematic letter edits.
examples: CARD GAMES WITH FIRST LETTER CHANGED (DIN, FRIDGE, GUMMY, JOKER → GIN, BRIDGE, RUMMY, POKER)
MUSIC GENRES PLUS A LETTER (BLUEST, POPE, ROCKY, SKAT → BLUES, POP, ROCK, SKA)
PALINDROMES (ABBA, KAYAK, NUN, STATS)
BEGINNING WITH DOUBLE LETTERS (AARDVARK, EERIE, LLAMA, OOZE)
“LL” CONTRACTIONS WITHOUT APOSTROPHE (HE'LL, I'LL, SHE'LL, WE'LL -> HELL, ILL, SHELL, WELL)
WORDS WHOSE ONLY VOWEL IS "Y" (MYRRH, NYMPH, RHYTHM, SPHYNX)
STARTING WITH METHODS OF TRANSPORTATION (BUSBOY, CARBON, SHIPSHAPE, TRAINEE)
BODY PART PLUS A STARTING LETTER (BARM, LEAR, RANKLE, SHIP)
STARTS OF EUROPEAN COUNTRIES (GERM, LUXE, MALT, PORT)
BIRDS MINUS LAST LETTER (CRAN, FLAMING, HERO, RAVE)
ENDING WITH PLAYING CARDS (BOJACK, HAWKING, LOVELACE, MCQUEEN)
STARTING WITH HIGH SCHOOL/COLLEGE ABBREVIATIONS (FRESHWATER, JUNIPER, SENECA, SOPHOCLES)

category_types.description: Sound-based relations: rhyme, alliteration, homophones/heterographs, silent letters, heteronyms, or spelling–pronunciation mismatches.
examples: HOMOPHONES (EWE, U, YEW, YOU)
OUGH WORDS THAT DON'T RHYME (BOUGH, COUGH, DOUGH, TOUGH)
WORDS PRONOUNCED SH WITHOUT AN SH (SEAN, SIOBHAN, SUGAR, SURE)
ENDING WITH SILENT T (BALLET, DEBUT, RAPPORT, TAROT)
STARTING WITH SILENT LETTERS (GNOME, KNEE, MNEMONIC, PSYCHE)
HOMOPHONES OF PARTS OF THE FOOT (BAWL, HEAL, SOUL, TOW)
ENDING WITH HOMOPHONES OF PARTS OF THE LEG (CRYPTO, DECAF, DISNEY, PRUSSIAN)

category_types.description: Grouping by part of speech, inflectional behavior, subcategorization frame, or shared discourse function.
examples: "AW, HECK!" EXCLAMATIONS (BLAST, CRUD, CURSES, FUDGE)
INTERJECTIONS (BOY, GOODNESS, MAN, WOW)
VOCATIVE TERMS OF ADDRESS (BUB, BUD, JACK, MAN)
TIME ADVERBS (LATER, NOW, SOON, THEN)
IRREGULAR ENGLISH PLURALS (DICE, LICE, MICE, OXEN)

category_types.description: Polysemy/ambiguity sets: different senses of the same cue, shared nicknames, contronyms, or tokens usable across distinct reference frames.
examples: WHAT “POP” MIGHT MEAN (BURST, FATHER, POPULAR, SODA)
THINGS YOU CAN PICK (APPLE, BANJO, CARD, NOSE)
BIRDS THAT ARE VERBS (DUCK, GROUSE, HAWK, SWALLOW)
THINGS YOU CAN DRAW (BATH, CARD, CURTAIN, PICTURE)
WHAT "BILL" MIGHT REFER TO (BANKNOTE, BEAK, INVOICE, WILLIAM)
WHAT "BUFF" MIGHT MEAN (ENTHUSIAST, MUSCULAR, NUDE, POLISH)
CONTENTS OF A POD (ASTRONAUT, COFFEE, PEA, WHALE)
WHAT “LEFT” MIGHT MEAN (DEPARTED, PORT, PROGRESSIVE, REMAINING)
WHAT “JET” MIGHT REFER TO (AIRPLANE, BLACK, HOT TUB NOZZLE, NFL PLAYER)
WHAT “ID” MIGHT REFER TO (FREUDIAN CONCEPT, IDAHO, DRIVER LICENSE, RECOGNIZE)
WHAT “IN” MIGHT REFER TO (INCH, INDIANA, INSIDE, TRENDY)
WHAT “LA” MIGHT REFER TO (LANTHANUM, LOS ANGELES, LOUISIANA, MUSICAL NOTE)
WHAT “OK” MIGHT REFER TO (BRITISH MAGAZINE, GREENLIGHT, MEDIOCRE, OKLAHOMA)

category_types.description: Ordered or cyclical series where rank, order, or cycle is essential (including graded scales).
examples: PARTS OF A FLIGHT (TAXI, TAKEOFF, CRUISE, TOUCHDOWN)
CONDITIONS FOR COLLECTIBLES (FAIR, FINE, GOOD, MINT)
DAYS OF THE WEEK (FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY, THURSDAY)

category_types.description: Patterns involving digits, counts, arithmetic, measurement, or conventional numeric labels/symbols.
examples: REPRESENTED BY THREE-DIGIT NUMBERS (CANNABIS=420, DEVIL=666, INTRO CLASS=101, JAMES BOND=007)
WAYS TO EXPRESS 1,000 (GRAND, K, M, THOU)
ROMAN NUMERALS (I, V, X, L, D, M)
CONTAIN A DIGIT (U2, R2-D2, 7-ELEVEN, MAROON 5)

category_types.description: Shared historical origin: loanwords from the same source language, eponyms/toponyms, or words grouped as tokens of a specified language.
examples: SPANISH WORDS (ELLA, GUSTO, MAYO, SOY)
WORDS DERIVED FROM JAPANESE (EMOJI, GINKGO, KARAOKE, TYCOON)
GERMAN WORDS (ANGST, DIE, KINDER, WURST)

category_types.description: Grouping by dialect, region, era, or register (slang, colloquial, formal, technical/jargon).
examples: SLANG FOR COFFEE (BREW, JAVA, MUD, ROCKET FUEL)
RADIO LINGO (COPY, NEGATIVE, OVER, ROGER)
SHAKESPEAREAN WORDS (ANON, ART, THOU, WILT)
BRITISHISMS (BUTTY, CHIPPY, FOOTY, TELLY)
TEXTING/CHAT ABBREVIATIONS (BRB, LOL, TTYL, IMO)
'80S SLANG (CHILL, PSYCH, RADICAL, WORD)

category_types.description: Translations of the same concept across different languages, or language-specific words grouped by a shared meaning.
examples: "MANY" IN DIFFERENT LANGUAGES (BEAUCOUP, MOLTO, MUCHO, MULTI)
